definition: to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: The requirements of enterprise establishment are one of the important contents of enterprise organization law.
sentences.chinese: 企業設立條件是企業組織法規範的重要內容之一。

sentences.english: The new Organic Act of eROC Military Law has been approved by eROC Congress.
sentences.chinese: 新國防部暨國軍組織法已通過議會表決。

sentences.english: We should adopt the legislation pattern for enterprises that enterprise organization law should be separated from enterprise development law.
sentences.chinese: 我國應將企業組織法和企業發展法分列立法的模式。

sentences.english: Their support to the Constitution was reported to be “without reservation”.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，它們對《組織法》的支持據說“毫無保留”。

definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
the right to be elected/the right to stand for election
